resource.name: NkrscM
resource.title: NKRS - cM

contact.name: Foundation National Institute for Cancer Epidemiology and Registration (NICER)

resource.description: The data item records the absence or presence of distant metastases based on clinical investigation, imaging, endoscopy, surgical exploration without biopsy.

text.div:
This value set contains 27 concepts

Expansion based on http://fhir.ch/ig/ch-crl/CodeSystem/nkrs-diagnosticmethodsused version 0.2.1

All codes from system http://fhir.ch/ig/ch-crl/CodeSystem/nkrs-diagnosticmethodsused

CodeDisplayDefinition
0Death certificate notification
1Clinical examination undefined
2Clinical examination defined
3Tumour clinically palpable
4Radiodiagnostic of tumour (Xray)
5Echography of tumour (ultrasound, sonography)
6Scintigraphy of tumour (e.g. MIBG)
7CT scan of tumour
8MRI scan of tumour
9Specific imaging of tumour (e.g. PET/CT, SPECT, fluorescent optical imaging)
10Imaging to determine spread of disease (metastases)
11Endoscopy
12Imaging NOS
13Specific markers ( biochemical or immunological)
14Cytogenetic analysis (karyotype)
15Molecular markers (FISH, SNP, MLPA, PCR, DNA sequence etc.)
16Cytology NOS / Blood smear / peripheral blood
17Cytology of tumour (e.g. fine needle aspirate/ PAP)
18Bone marrow aspirate
19Bone marrow biopsy
20Biopsy unspecified
21Biopsy locoregional
22Biopsy of metastasis
23Biopsy of primary tumour
24Biopsy and resection (z.B. melanoma)
25Surgical tissue from operation (e.g. neuroendocrine tumours)
26Autopsy with histological confirmation

resource.name: NkrsDiagnosticMethodsUsed
resource.title: NKRS - Diagnostic Methods Used

contact.name: Foundation National Institute for Cancer Epidemiology and Registration (NICER)

resource.description: The data item records all diagnostic methods used.

contains.display: Specific imaging of tumour (e.g. PET/CT, SPECT, fluorescent optical imaging)
Imaging to determine spread of disease (metastases)
Molecular markers (FISH, SNP, MLPA, PCR, DNA sequence etc.)
Cytology NOS / Blood smear / peripheral blood
Cytology of tumour (e.g. fine needle aspirate/ PAP)
Surgical tissue from operation (e.g. neuroendocrine tumours)

text.div:
This value set contains 4 concepts

Expansion based on http://fhir.ch/ig/ch-crl/CodeSystem/nkrs-icdo3behaviour version 0.2.1

All codes from system http://fhir.ch/ig/ch-crl/CodeSystem/nkrs-icdo3behaviour

CodeDisplayDefinition
0BenignBenign tumours do not metastasize or locally invade tissues.
1BorderlineUncertain whether benign or malignant. Low, borderline, or uncertain malignant potential.
2In situCarcinoma in situ; intraepithelial; non-infiltrating; non-invasive.
3MalignantInvasive behaviour.

resource.name: NkrsIcdO3Behaviour
resource.title: NKRS - ICD-O-3 Behaviour

contact.name: Foundation National Institute for Cancer Epidemiology and Registration (NICER)

resource.description: This data item records the behaviour of the neoplasm at time of diagnosis according to ICD-O.

text.div:
This value set contains 8 concepts

Expansion based on http://fhir.ch/ig/ch-crl/CodeSystem/nkrs-icdo3histologicalgrade version 0.2.1

All codes from system http://fhir.ch/ig/ch-crl/CodeSystem/nkrs-icdo3histologicalgrade

CodeDisplayDefinition
1Grade IWell differentiated; Differentiated, NOS; Low grade
2Grade IIModerately (well) differentiated; Intermediate differentiation.
3Grade IIIPoorly differentiated; Dedifferentiated; High grade.
4Grade IVUndifferentiated; Anaplastic.
5T-cellT-cell; T-precursor.
6B-cellB-cell; Pre-B; B-precursor.
7Null cellNull cell; Non-T-non-B.
8NK cellNK cell; Natural killer cell.

resource.name: NkrsIcdO3HistologicalGrade
resource.title: NKRS - ICD-O-3 Histological Grade

contact.name: Foundation National Institute for Cancer Epidemiology and Registration (NICER)

resource.description: The data item describes the neoplasm’s resemblance to normal (parent) tissue according to ICD-O.

text.div:
This value set contains 4 concepts

Expansion based on http://fhir.ch/ig/ch-crl/CodeSystem/nkrs-icdo3laterality version 0.2.1

All codes from system http://fhir.ch/ig/ch-crl/CodeSystem/nkrs-icdo3laterality

CodeDisplayDefinition
1Right
2Left
3Unilateral, NOSUnilateral, but unknown whether right or left.
4BilateralOrigin of primary tumour is on both sides of a paired organ (when tumours of the same morphology are diagnosed simultaneously in both sides of a paired organ). Bilateral cancers are very rare, e.g. bilateral retinoblastoma, bilateral Wilms tumour of the kidney, or both ovaries involved simultaneously.

resource.name: NkrsIcdO3Laterality
resource.title: NKRS - ICD-O-3 Laterality

contact.name: Foundation National Institute for Cancer Epidemiology and Registration (NICER)

resource.description: Laterality describes the side of a paired organ or side of the body on which the reportable cancer originated.

text.div:
This value set contains 3 concepts

Expansion based on http://fhir.ch/ig/ch-crl/CodeSystem/nkrs-lymphaticinvasion version 0.2.1

All codes from system http://fhir.ch/ig/ch-crl/CodeSystem/nkrs-lymphaticinvasion

CodeDisplayDefinition
0L0No lymphatic invasion.
1L1Lymphatic invasion.
8LXLymphatic invasion cannot be assessed.

resource.name: NkrsLymphaticInvasion
resource.title: NKRS - Lymphatic Invasion

contact.name: Foundation National Institute for Cancer Epidemiology and Registration (NICER)

resource.description: The data item indicates the presence or absence of tumour cells in lymphatic vessels within and at the margins of the primary tumour, as well as afferent and efferent lymphatics, as noted microscopically by the pathologist.

This value set contains 1 concepts

mUnspecified multiplicity

resource.name: NkrsmSuffixOfpT
resource.title: NKRS - m-Suffix of pT

contact.name: Foundation National Institute for Cancer Epidemiology and Registration (NICER)

resource.description: The data item records the unspecified multiplicity of multiple primary tumours at a single site.

resource.name: NkrsPerineuralInvasion
resource.title: NKRS - Perineural Invasion

contact.name: Foundation National Institute for Cancer Epidemiology and Registration (NICER)

resource.description: Perineural invasion is the process of neoplastic invasion of nerves.

resource.title: NKRS - pM

contact.name: Foundation National Institute for Cancer Epidemiology and Registration (NICER)

resource.description: The data item records the absence or presence of distant metastasis, based on pathological evidence after completion of surgical therapy or microscopic examination of metastasis.

All codes from system http://fhir.ch/ig/ch-crl/CodeSystem/nkrs-venousinvasion

CodeDisplayDefinition
0V0No venous invasion.
1V1Microscopic venous invasion.
2V2Macroscopic venous invasion.

resource.name: NkrsVenousInvasion
resource.title: NKRS - Venous Invasion

contact.name: Foundation National Institute for Cancer Epidemiology and Registration (NICER)

resource.description: The data item indicates the presence or absence of tumour cells in the walls of venous blood vessels, as noted microscopically by the pathologist.
